Will_Chase:
{{Short description|American actor and singer (born 1970)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{infobox person | name = Will Chase | image = Will_Chase_backstage.png | caption = Chase backstage at ''[[Something Rotten!]]'' in 2016 (photo by Deb Lopez) | birth_name = Frank William Chase | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1970|9|12}} | birth_place = [[Frankfort, Kentucky]] | education = [[Oberlin College]] ([[Bachelor of Music|BM]]) | occupation = {{hlist|Actor|director|singer}} | years_active = 1998–present | spouse = {{ubl|{{marriage|Lori Davis|1998|2008|end=div}}|{{marriage|Stephanie Gibson|2009|2012|end=div}}}} | partner = [[Debra Messing]] (2011–2014)
[[Ingrid Michaelson]] (2015–present) | children = 2 | website = {{URL|will-chase.com}} }} '''Frank William Chase''' (born September 12, 1970) is an American actor, director, and singer, best known for his work on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] and for his role as country superstar Luke Wheeler on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]''. ==Early life and education== Chase was born in [[Frankfort, Kentucky]], to Betty and Jerry Chase, and is the youngest of three sons. He graduated from [[Western Hills High School (Frankfort, Kentucky)|Western Hills High School]] and the [[Oberlin Conservatory of Music]], where he studied conducting with [[Robert Spano]] and percussion with Michael Rosen.{{cite web |last=Feldman |first=Ed |url=http://216.92.38.150/spot/chase3.html |title=Spotlight on Will Chase |website=Talkin' Broadway |access-date= July 11, 2009}}{{cite web |last=BWW News Desk |url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/Photo_Flash_THE_STORY_OF_MY_LIFE_20090108 |title=The Story of My Life |website=broadwayworld.com |date=January 8, 2009}} ==Career== Chase started his acting career in Chicago, performing in regional theater productions and received three [[Joseph Jefferson Award]] nominations. He then played Chris in the 2nd National Tour of ''[[Miss Saigon]]''. He first performed on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] in 1998 as the Squeegee Man and Mark/Roger understudy in ''[[Rent (musical)|Rent]]'', and went on to star as Roger in the final Broadway company of ''Rent'', which was recorded for the theatrical release entitled ''[[Rent: Filmed Live on Broadway (film)|Rent: Filmed Live on Broadway]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.ibdb.com/production.php?id=4791 |title=Rent |publisher=Internet Broadway Database |access-date=July 11, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.playbill.com/article/rent-filmed-live-on-broadway-appears-on-dvd-and-blu-ray-feb-3-com-157577 |title="Rent: Filmed Live on Broadway" Appears on DVD and Blu-Ray Feb. 3 |date=February 3, 2009 |last=Jones |first=Kenneth |website=Playbill}} His additional Broadway credits in the early 2000s include ''[[Miss Saigon]]'' (with the original star [[Lea Salonga]] playing Kim to close the Broadway production); ''[[The Full Monty (musical)|The Full Monty]]'' (2001); ''[[Aida (musical)|Aida]]'' (Radames replacement, 2003–04); and ''[[Lennon (musical)|Lennon]]'' (2005). Tony in ''[[Billy Elliot the Musical]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=79108 |title=Will Chase |publisher=Internet Broadway Database |access-date=July 11, 2009}} He was also in ''[[A Little Princess (Lippa musical)|A Little Princess the Musical]]'' as Captain Crewe. In 2005, he played Neville Craven in the 2005 [[World AIDS Day]] ''[[The Secret Garden (musical)|The Secret Garden]]'' concert.{{cite web |last1=Gans |first1=Andrew |last2=Jones |first2=Kenneth |url=http://www.playbill.com/article/chase-pasquale-cavenaugh-and-more-join-all-star-secret-garden-benefit-concert-com-129134 |title=Chase, Pasquale, Cavenaugh and More Join All-Star Secret Garden Benefit Concert |website=Playbill |date=November 11, 2005}} In 2006, he starred in ''[[High Fidelity (musical)|High Fidelity]]'' on Broadway, and played Valentin in ''[[Kiss of the Spider Woman (musical)|Kiss of the Spider Woman]]'' at the [[Signature Theatre (Arlington, Virginia)|Signature Theatre]] in Arlington, Virginia, for which he received a nomination for the 2009 [[Helen Hayes Awards Non-Resident Acting|Helen Hayes Award for Outstanding Lead Actor]].{{cite web|url=http://boston.broadwayworld.com/article/Will_Chase_is_Valentin_in_Signatures_Spider_Woman_with_Di_20080126 |title=Will Chase is Valentin in Signature's 'Spider Woman' with Di |website= BroadwayWorld.com |date=January 26, 2008}} He appeared in ''[[The Pajama Game]]'' opposite [[Kate Baldwin]] at [[The Muny]] (St. Louis) in July 2007.{{cite web |last=Gans |first=Andrew |url=http://www.playbill.com/article/chase-and-baldwin-play-the-pajama-game-at-the-muny-beginning-july-23-com-142405 |title=Chase and Baldwin Play The Pajama Game at the Muny Beginning July 23 |website=Playbill |date= July 23, 2007}} He starred in ''[[Oklahoma (musical)|Oklahoma]]'' in 2007 at the [[Lyric Theatre (1998 New York City)|Lyric Theatre]] opposite [[Kelli O'Hara]], and on Broadway in the short-lived musical ''[[The Story of My Life (musical)|The Story of My Life]]'' in 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.ibdb.com/production.php?id=481923 |title=The Story of My Life |publisher=Internet Broadway Database |access-date=July 11, 2009}} Starting in 2009, Chase played the role of Tony in ''[[Billy Elliot the Musical]]''{{cite web |url=http://www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=79108 |title=Will Chase |publisher=Internet Broadway Database |access-date=July 11, 2009}} until 2011. In August 2012, he temporarily filled in for [[Matthew Broderick]] as Jimmy Winter in the Broadway musical, ''[[Nice Work If You Can Get It (musical)|Nice Work If You Can Get It]]''.{{Cite web|last=Hall|first=Margaret|date=30 July 2012|title=Will Chase Will Dance Into ''Nice Work If You Can Get'' It During Matthew Broderick's Vacation|url=https://playbill.com/article/will-chase-will-dance-into-nice-work-if-you-can-get-it-during-matthew-brodericks-vacation-com-196150|website=Playbill}} At the [[2013 Tony Awards]], he was nominated for [[Tony Award for Best Featured Actor in a Musical]] for his role as John Jasper/Mr. Clive Paget in the Broadway revival of ''[[Drood|The Mystery of Edwin Drood]]''.[http://www.playbill.com/production/the-mystery-of-edwin-drood-studio-54-vault-0000013878# ''Drood''] Playbill (vault). Retrieved July 24, 2019 Chase guest starred as Michael Swift in the [[National Broadcasting Company|NBC]] series ''[[Smash (TV series)|Smash]]''.{{cite web |url=http://broadwayworld.com/article/Will-Chase-Joins-the-Cast-of-SMASH-on-NBC-20110829 |title=Will Chase Joins the Cast of SMASH on NBC |date=August 29, 2011 |publisher=Broadway World}} He then went on to star for 3 seasons as country superstar Luke Wheeler on the television series ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]''. His other television appearances include ''[[Quantico (TV series)|Quantico]]'', HBO's ''[[The Deuce (TV series)|The Deuce]]'', the recurring role of Pat Mahoney on ''[[Rescue Me (American TV series)|Rescue Me]]'', ''[[Cupid (2009 TV series)|Cupid]]'', ''[[Canterbury's Law]]'', ''[[Law & Order]]'', ''[[Third Watch]]'', ''[[Conviction (2006 TV series)|Conviction]]'', and ''[[Queens Supreme]]'', [[Hallmark Channel|Hallmark]]'s ''[[The Lost Valentine]]'', alongside [[Jennifer Love Hewitt]] and [[Betty White]]; the 2011 season finale of ''[[Royal Pains]]'' (USA); ''[[Blue Bloods (TV series)|Blue Bloods]]'' (CBS); and the ABC drama ''[[Pan Am (TV series)|Pan Am]]''. In 2012, he appeared on the series ''[[White Collar (TV series)|White Collar]]'', in the episode "[[Neighborhood Watch (White Collar)|Neighborhood Watch]]", and appeared on the series ''[[Unforgettable (2011 TV series)|Unforgettable]]'', in the episode "The Comeback". He played the title role in the 2013 film ''Butterflies of Bill Baker'', winning Best Actor at the 2013 Chain Film Festival.{{cite web |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2327714/ |title=Butterflies of Bill Baker |publisher=IMDb |access-date=October 27, 2015}} Chase also voiced the wolf Angee in ''[[A Warrior's Tail]]'' (2016).{{cite web |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4075322/combined |title=Savva. Heart of the Warrior |publisher=IMDb |access-date=October 27, 2015}} In 2016, Chase assumed the role of [[William Shakespeare]] from [[Christian Borle]] on Broadway in the musical ''[[Something Rotten!]]'',Hetrick, Adam. [http://www.playbill.com/article/christian-borle-sets-something-rotten-departure# "Christian Borle Sets 'Something Rotten!' Departure"] ''Playbill'', June 23, 2016 while simultaneously filming both HBO's ''[[The Deuce (TV series)|The Deuce]]'', and the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] drama ''[[Time After Time (American TV series)|Time After Time]]'', in the series regular role of Griffin Monroe.{{cite web | url=https://deadline.com/2016/07/will-chase-recurring-the-deuce-hbo-porn-industry-drama-series-1201792835/ | title=Will Chase Joins 'The Deuce' HBO Drama Series | date=July 26, 2016 }}{{cite web | url=https://tvseriesfinale.com/tv-show/nashville-will-chase-staying-abc-time-time/ | title=Nashville: Will Chase Staying on ABC—on Time After Time | date=August 19, 2016 }} He played abusive father Neil Hargrove in the second season of the American supernatural horror-science fiction television series, ''[[Stranger Things]]'', which premiered in late 2017, and in 2018 appeared in HBO's drama ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]'' as Bob Nash.[https://www.hbo.com/sharp-objects/cast-and-crew " ''Sharp Objects'' Cast and Crew"] hbo.com. Retrieved July 24, 2019{{cite web | url=https://tvline.com/2017/05/03/stranger-things-season-2-will-chase-cast/ | title=Stranger Things Season 2: Nashville Vet Will Chase Joins Cast as [Spoiler] | date=May 3, 2017 }} He starred as Fred Graham/Petruchio opposite [[Kelli O'Hara]] in the 2019 Broadway revival of ''[[Kiss Me, Kate]]''.Clement, Olivia. [http://www.playbill.com/article/kelli-ohara-to-return-to-broadway-in-kiss-me-kate "Kelli O'Hara to Return to Broadway in ''Kiss Me, Kate''"], ''Playbill'', November 6, 2017. Retrieved July 8, 2018 In 2020 and 2021, he wrote and directed the award- winning short film ''Dagger'', co-starring [[Jack Davenport]], and ''Trunk Show'', which featured his children, actors Daisy and Gracie Chase, winning Best Short Film at the 2021 Ridgewood Guild International Film Festival.{{cite web | url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0153855/awards/ | title=Will Chase | website=[[IMDb]] }} Also in 2021, he played Michael Friedman in [[Danny Strong]]’s [[Pulitzer Prize]]-winning series ''[[Dopesick (miniseries)|Dopesick]]''.{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2021/01/dopesick-jaime-ray-newman-andrea-frankle-will-chase-hulu-opioid-crisis-1234682225/|title='Dopesick': Jaime Ray Newman, Andrea Frankle & Will Chase To Recur On Hulu's Limited Series|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|first=Erik|last=Pederson|date=January 28, 2021|access-date=January 28, 2021|archive-date=January 28, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128180118/https://deadline.com/2021/01/dopesick-jaime-ray-newman-andrea-frankle-will-chase-hulu-opioid-crisis-1234682225/|url-status=live}} In 2022, he played Kurt Dockweiler in the first season of ''[[Bosch: Legacy]]''. That same year he finished production on Apple TV's ''[[The Crowded Room]]'', starring alongside [[Tom Holland]] and [[Emmy Rossum]] which premiered in June of 2023. {{Cite web |last1=Flam |first1=Charna |last2=Franklin |first2=McKinley |last3=Scorziello |first3=Sophia |date=2023-04-07 |title='The Crowded Room': First Look at Tom Holland and Amanda Seyfried in Apple TV+ Limited Series (TV News Roundup) |url=https://variety.com/2023/tv/news/the-crowded-room-first-look-tom-holland-amanda-seyfried-appletv-1235570611/ |access-date=2023-05-09 |website=Variety}} In 2024, Chase directed the feature documentary ''Coming Home: The Guggenheim Grotto Back In Ireland'' and Mick Lynch's one-man show ''An Irish Goodbye'' at Kaatsbaan Cultural Park. {{cite web |url=https://dutchesstourism.com/event-view/39981_2024_04_20 |title=Mick Lynch An Irish Goodbye at Kaatsbaan |publisher=Dutchess Tourism}} In 2025 he will direct the musical short film ''Here, Bullet'', which he co-wrote with composer Kurt Erickson, based on Erickson's prize-winning song cycle of the same name, which was adapted from the original anthology of 2005 [[Beatrice Hawley Award]]-winning poems, "Here, Bullet", by renowned American poet [[Brian Turner (American poet)|Brian Turner]].{{cite web | url=https://www.will-chase.com/news | title=News }} ==Personal life== Chase has two children, actors Daisy and Gracie Chase, with the late Lori Davis, to whom he was married from 1996 to 2008.{{cite news |url=http://www.wwpinfo.com/index.php/component/us1more/?key=1-10-14broadway&more=1&action=comment |title=Stars of Broadway Align for Theatrical Benefit at South |date=January 10, 2014 |last=Miller |first=Lynn |newspaper=West Windsor & Plainsboro News}} He was married to actress Stephanie Gibson from 2009[https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/15/fashion/weddings/15gibson.html "Weddings. Stephanie Gibson, Will Chase"] ''The New York Times'', November 14, 2009 until their divorce in 2012. He and [[Debra Messing]] dated from 2011 to 2014.Lee, Esther; Brown, Brody. [https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/debra-messing-will-chase-split-after-nearly-3-years-of-dating-20142710/ "Debra Messing and Will Chase Split After Nearly Two-and-a-Half Years of Dating"] ''US Magazine'', October 27, 2014Saad, Nadine. [https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-debra-messing-will-chase-split-breakup-20141027-story.html "Debra Messing and Will Chase split up after sparking during 'Smash'"] ''Los Angeles Times'', October 27, 2014 Chase has been in a relationship with musician [[Ingrid Michaelson]] since 2015.{{Cite news|url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/ingrid-michaelson-dating-will-chase-following-split-photo-201577/|title=Ingrid Michaelson Dating Will Chase Following Split: Photo|date=July 7, 2015|work=Us Weekly|access-date=February 7, 2018}} ==Filmography== ===Actor=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Title !Role !Notes |- | 2000 || ''[[Shaft (2000 film)|Shaft]]'' || Walter's Friend || Film |- | 2001 || ''Fling'' (FOX network, created by [[Glenn Gordon Caron]]) || Dan Fields || Episode: #1.2 "In Genes We Trust" |- | 2002 || ''[[Guiding Light]]'' || Store Manager || Episode dated August 14, 2002 |- | 2002 || ''[[Third Watch]]'' || Reilly || Episode: #4.8 "Ladies' Day" |- | 2003 || ''[[Queens Supreme]]'' || ADA Pheiffer || Episode: #1.1 "One Angry Man" |- | 2003 || ''[[Law & Order]]'' || David || Episode: #13.11 "Chosen" |- | 2004 || ''[[Everyday People (film)|Everyday People]]'' || Dad (uncredited) || HBO Film |- | 2004 || ''[[Law & Order]]'' || Mellors' Co-Owner || Episode: #14.18 "Evil Breeds" |- | 2006 || ''[[Conviction (2006 TV series)|Conviction]]'' || Detective Dave Lamanski || Episode: #1.4 "Indebted" |- | 2006 || ''[[As the World Turns]]'' || Dr. Linn || Episode dated May 1, 2006
